text: Sean Michael Spicer (born September 23, 1971) is an American political strategist. He was the 30th White House Press Secretary and Communications Director for President Trump until his resignation on July 21, 2017. Spicer was communications director of the Republican National Committee from 2011 to 2017 and its chief strategist from 2015 to 2017. On December 22, 2016, Spicer was named as Trump's White House Press Secretary and two days later Spicer was also named as the White House Communications Director. He assumed both positions with Trump's inauguration on January 20, 2017. On July 21, 2017, Spicer announced his intention to resign as White House Press Secretary, and formally left the White House on August 31, 2017.Glenn Thrush, Sean Spicer Resigns as White House Press Secretary, New York Times (July 21, 2017). ==References== Category:1971 births Category:Living people Category:White House Press Secretaries Category:White House Communications Directors Category:Politicians from New York (state) Category:Republican Party (United States) politicians
title: Sean Spicer
